isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - REAR WINDOW GLASS ON VEHICLES WITH VAN BODY

svcproc.title: REAR WINDOW GLASS ON VEHICLES WITH VAN BODY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Window Glass on Vehicles with Van Body on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models
svcsubproc.para: The 4100, 4200, 4300 and 4400 model vehicles come standard with a bonded in rear window glass (Figure 14) .

important.para: To remove a rear window glass you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has a tool box that includes the tools required to remove and install the bonded rear window glass. To order, call toll free in U. S. and Canada 1-800-520-2584 or Fax 1-800-578-7375. NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.

note.para:
Before starting to remove and replace a rear window glass, it is required that a self-carboning form from INTERNATIONAL® titled "Bonded Windshield Replacement Report" be filled out completely to confirm the condition of the vehicle and record the lot numbers of the Essex materials used before starting the work. Refer to Figure 205
for a sample form at the back of this Manual.

step1.para: Place protective coverings over areas near rear window glass inside the cab.

Before removing rear window glass, it may be necessary to remove the seats. Refer to SEATS, Remove driver or passenger seats
.
Remove bonded rear window glass as follows.

warning.para: Wear protective eye wear and work gloves when removing rear window glass.

note.para: When using a power knife to cut around the old rear window glass, use a spray bottle and lubricate the cutting area with water (Figure 11) . This will prevent burning of the urethane and re-bonding of the windshield.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 17 for Items in parentheses.

To remove a rear window glass from a vehicle with a van body, you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has two special suction cups (Item 1) and a slide rail (Item 2), which will need to be assembled. ( NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.) They are required to remove and install the bonded rear window glass from between the cab and the van body.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Rear Window Removal and Installation Tool

step1.para: Assemble slide rail (Item 2) by assembling the two top rails (Item 3) to the bottom rail (Item 4). The three rails are identical and can be assembled in any one of the three locations. Line up holes in two top rails with holes in the bottom rail. Install four flat head screws (Item 5) into two holes in each top rail and through four holes in bottom rail. Install four wing nuts (Item 6) and tighten securely.

Before installing the two suction cups on the back of the van body, clean the area on the van body where the suction cups will be installed, so that the suction cups will stick securely to the back of the van body.

caution.para: It is very important that the area on the back of the van body where the suction cups are being installed, is cleaned properly before the suction cups are installed on the van body. If the suction cups come off during the removal or installation of the rear window glass, the rear window glass would be destroyed and the vehicle damaged.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 18
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
Install one suction cup (Item 1) on the van body between the back of the cab and the van body on the driver's side, so that the slide rail will be just below the bottom edge of the rear window glass. With the suction cup placed against the back of the van body, repeatedly push plunger (Item 2) until the red line (Item 7, Figure 17)
on the plunger is not visible. Throughout the procedure of removing and installing a rear window glass, check to see if the red line is starting to appear on the suction cup, if the red line is visible, push the plunger until the red line is no longer visible.

Install the other suction cup (Item 3) on the van body between the back of the cab and the van body on the passengers side, so that the slide rail will be just below the bottom edge of the rear window glass. With the suction cup placed against the back of the van body, repeatedly push plunger until the red line (Item 7, Figure 17)
on the plunger is not visible. Throughout the procedure of removing and installing a rear window glass, check to see if the red line is starting to appear on the suction cup, if the red line is visible, push the plunger until the red line is no longer visible.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Install Suction Cups on Van Body

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 19
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once both suction cups (Item 1) have been properly install to the back of the van body, position the slide rail (Item 2) across the block (Item 3) on each suction cup.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Install Slide Rail on Suction Cups on Van Body

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 20
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On driver side, align the hole in the slide rail (Item 1) with the hole in the block (Item 2) on the suction cup (Item 3). Install pin (Item 4) through slide rail and suction cup to secure slide rail on the suction cup.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Install Pin Through Slide Rail into Suction Cup Block on Driver Side

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 21
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
It will be necessary to reposition the suction cup (Item 1) on the passenger side to align the hole in the slide rail (Item 2) with the hole in the block (Item 3) on the suction cup. Install pin (Item 4) through slide rail and suction cup to secure slide rail on the suction cup. With the suction cup placed against the back of the van body, repeatedly push plunger (Item 2, Figure 18) ) until the red line (Item 7, Figure 17)
on the plunger is not visible.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Install Pin Through Slide Rail into Suction Cup Block on Passenger Side

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 22
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the rear window glass (Item 1) is cut completely free from window fence, install a suction cup (Item 2) on the left hand side of the rear window glass

figure.caption: Figure 22. Installing Suction Cup on Rear Window Glass

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 15
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using a power knife (Item 1) with short inside cutting blade (Item 2), work cutting blade between rear window and rear window glass fence (Item 3). Cut all the way around the rear window glass until it is free from the cab rear window glass fence all the way around the rear window.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 23
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the rear window glass (Item 1) is cut free from the cab rear window glass fence, using the suction cup (Item 2), tilt the top of rear window glass out enough to grab the top of rear window glass with the other hand. Lift the rear window glass off window glass fence and place it in the slide rail. Lean the top of rear window glass against the van body.
Using the suction cup (Item 2), slide the rear window glass (Item 1) down the slide rail enough to grab the rear window glass from outside the cab.
Remove the suction cup (Item 2) from the rear window glass (Item 1).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Removing Rear Window Glass from Vehicle

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From outside the cab, slide the rear window glass (Item 1) down the slide rail and lift the rear window glass off the slide rail. Place rear window glass out of the way.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Removing Rear Window Glass from Vehicle
